author: Ryan Hughes
title: Comcast Expands Digital Equity with Innovative Lift Zone
text: Comcast Expands Digital Equity with Innovative Lift Zone [Ryan Hughes](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79047)Updated: 10-17-2024 05:55 PM Comcast Launches Its First Flagship Lift Zone to Enhance Digital Equity In an effort to strengthen digital equity, Comcast has partnered with Inspiredu to launch its inaugural Flagship Lift Zone. This initiative is designed to provide free WiFi access and a substantial grant for technology enhancements, ultimately facilitating virtual digital skills training. The Impact of the Lift Zone Initiative Comcast’s Flagship Lift Zone is the culmination of a five-year collaboration with Inspiredu, aiming to deliver essential internet access alongside educational resources. The installation not only offers reliable internet connectivity but also marks a significant investment exceeding $500,000 to upgrade facilities and enhance program offerings. Empowering Communities Through Connectivity At the heart of this initiative lies the commitment to empower individuals with the knowledge and tools needed to navigate the digital world. As Loren Hudson, Senior Vice President and Chief Diversity Officer at Comcast explains, "Lift Zones are about more than just providing free access to the Internet. They are about teaching people how to use the power of broadband to transform their lives and careers. With this Flagship Lift Zone, Inspiredu will now be able to make an even greater impact." This partnership signifies a progressive step toward breaking down barriers that prevent full internet access. Comprehensive Digital Skill Development Comcast's Lift Zones program is a key feature of Project UP, which represents a $1 billion commitment to advancing digital equity. This program is vital to offering internet access outside the home, complementing the Internet Essentials initiative supporting lower-income families. Unlocking Educational Opportunities Richard Hicks, the CEO & President of Inspiredu, highlighted the transformative potential of this collaboration: "These resources will help us expand our reach, allowing us to provide digital skills training classes remotely to anyone, anywhere in Georgia." This commitment shows how Comcast is not only delivering internet access but also creating pathways for education and career development. Enhancements Through Technology To ensure maximum outreach and effectiveness, Comcast and Inspiredu devised a tailored approach for technological upgrades. With Comcast's support, Inspiredu is integrating advanced technology solutions, including digital cameras and connected classrooms featuring large screens for hybrid learning. This investment highlights the commitment to ensuring that all students receive appropriate education, whether in-person or online. Training the Next Generation of Digital Professionals Inspiredu aims to address the skills gap by enhancing its education programs, facilitated by the additional resources from Comcast. The partnership will double the teaching staff, increasing the variety of courses offered, from cybersecurity to financial literacy, reflecting a growing demand in the digital job market. Investing in Local Communities In the past three years alone, Comcast has donated over $47.9 million to more than 70 Georgia-based nonprofit organizations. This investment supports a broad array of community programs dedicated to fostering digital equity and ensuring everyone has access to vital resources for professional success. About Inspiredu Inspiredu is a non-profit organization based in Georgia, with a mission to close the gap in digital access and literacy. Through its digital workshops, participants gain essential skills, such as internet safety and software proficiency. By equipping marginalized communities, Inspiredu aims to bridge the digital divide that affects many low-income families. About Comcast Corporation Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ: CMCSA) stands as a leading global media and technology enterprise. Through its various platforms and services, Comcast is committed to connecting millions of customers across the globe, delivering premier connectivity and content. The organization continues to innovate and expand its offerings while striving to make digital accessibility a priority. Frequently Asked Questions What is the purpose of Comcast's Flagship Lift Zone? The Flagship Lift Zone initiative aims to enhance digital equity by providing free WiFi access and training opportunities for communities. How will this partnership affect local communities? This partnership will empower communities by offering digital skills training, ensuring broader access to technology and educational resources. What is Project UP by Comcast? Project UP is Comcast's substantial commitment, amounting to $1 billion, dedicated to promoting digital equity and providing internet access to underserved communities. How does Inspiredu contribute to digital equity? Inspiredu works to provide devices and training to marginalized citizens in Georgia, facilitating their access to the digital world and essential skills. What future expansions are planned for the Lift Zone program? Comcast plans to continue expanding its Lift Zones across various communities, aiming to enhance digital learning and access to technology. author: Samiar Nefzi
title: Stolen ashes of late husband returned to grateful Pembroke Pines woman
text:
PEMBROKE PINES, Fla. – A South Florida woman is feeling joy and relief after her late husbands ashes have been returned.
They were stolen from her Pembroke Pines home earlier this week along with a safe.
Now, Maria Araya said she is able to sleep in peace.
“I feel so happy, I can’t believe it,” she said. “It’s like a miracle that he’s back to me again.”
On Wednesday, Local 10 News reported on the crooks who broken into Arya’s home.
They cut through the screen of her back porch and smashed through an older window to get inside.
The crooks than took a small safe with money and documents inside, but that’s not what Arya was concerned about.
Rather, the most meaningful property was a memorial lockbox with the ashes of her late husband Juan Araya, who passed away nine years ago.
“I asked God, ‘please God, use your power and blessing, bring my husband’s ashes to me,’” she said.
Her prayers were answered after two city workers located the memorial lockbox down the road from her home.
“He’s like a treasure,” she said. “He was my angel in life, now he’s an angel in heaven,” Araya said.
Copyright 2024 by WPLG Local10.com - All rights reserved.

author: MENAFN
title: Ghana's Economic Growth Rebounding: President | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - Daily News Egypt) Ghana's economic growth is rebounding following three difficult years, Ghanaian President Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo has said.
In his Christmas message late Monday, Akufo-Addo said Ghana has turned the corner following three difficult years Ghana and the world have faced.
“Inflation is being reigned in, we are experiencing a relatively stable exchange rate, and growth in our economy is rebounding,” he said.
“The country is not yet completely out of the woods, but there is a growing confidence that with hard work and determination, Ghana will make it, and collectively, we will secure our future,” the president added.
Akufo-Addo called on Ghanaians to exhibit their hospitality toward tourists flocking to the West African country during the festive season to boost the tourism sector for socio-economic and cultural growth.
Once a model of economic growth in Africa, Ghana has been grappling with economic crises over recent years. The Ghanaian government is currently undertaking an economic reform with a bailout package of 3 billion U.S. dollars from the International Monetary Fund, hoping to rebound its economy.
MENAFN28122023000153011029ID1107666108

author: Fernanda Rangel
title: Reconstrucción mamaria gratuita para mujeres ¿dónde y quienes la pueden recibir?
text: El Hospital General “Rubén Leñero” ofrecerá reconstrucción mamaria gratuita para las mujeres sobrevivientes de cáncer con la condición de haber concluido su tratamiento en cualquier unidad de oncología de la Ciudad de México. [ÚNETE A NUESTRO CANAL DE WHATSAPP. EL PODER DE LA INFORMACIÓN EN LA PALMA DE TU MANO](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va6evSkGk1Ftej78ks0B) [SÍGUENOS EN EL SHOWCASE DE GOOGLE NEWS](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMKffiQswz_qbAw?hl=es-419&gl=MX&ceid=MX%3Aes-419) Te podría interesar Incluso si la mujer no cuenta con Seguridad Social o no es población abierta puede acceder al servicio, dijo la doctora Lya Vázquez Morales, jefa del servicio de Cirugía Plástica y Reconstructiva del hospital. Las interesadas en el servicio deben acudir al Centro de Salud IMSS-BIENESTAR más cercano a su domicilio y solicitar que se les dé un pase al “Rubén Leñero” donde los médicos realizarán una evaluación de su estado de salud para decidir si son o no candidatas. Te podría interesar Nadine Gassman, secretaria de Salud de la Ciudad de México, informó que este hospital tiene capacidad para hacer hasta 180 reconstrucciones mamarias al año y añadió que en lo que va del 2024 han ayudado a 110 mujeres. Resaltó la importancia de la reconstrucción mamaria, ya que para las mujeres el recuperar sus senos logran mejorar su autoestima, confianza y eventualmente recobrar su sexualidad. “La reconstrucción mamaria cambia la vida de las mujeres, les ayuda a recuperar el cuerpo, la autoestima y la sexualidad. Desde el gobierno de la Ciudad de México seguiremos trabajando con la red de servicios públicos para garantizar una atención integral” dijo Gassman. Lo que necesitas saber de este programa de cirugía reconstructiva Una vez que la mujer haya solicitado una referencia al hospital “Rubén Leñero”, el personal de salud hará una valoración del caso ya que el procedimiento y qué tan exitoso puede ser dependen del tipo de cáncer y la posible presencia de alguna otra enfermedad como diabetes, hipertensión u obesidad. En caso de que la mujer sea candidata los médicos le presentarán el material protésico que usarán para reconstruir su seno, los detalles sobre el relleno de los mismo (salino o de gel) se verán directamente en consulta. Luego los médicos dejarán pasar 35 días para iniciar con el procedimiento de reconstrucción con tejidos autólogos (tomados de la misma paciente) que pueden ser de la espalda, abdomen, glúteos, ingles o muslos para usarse durante la cirugía. Entre los grandes males En 2023 se registraron 8 mil 34 muertes de mujeres a causa de cáncer de mama, según el Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Geografía (INEGI). Si el tumor se atiende cuando va comenzando la tasa de supervivencia es de 90%; si el mal se encuentra hasta que ya hizo metástasis sólo sobrevive 30% de las pacientes, de acuerdo con información de la Sociedad Americana de Cáncer. La autoexploración constante desde los 20 años y practicarse mamografías anualmente a partir de los 40 son de gran importancia para prevenir el cáncer de mama, que es la tercera causa de muerte para la mujer y el cáncer que causa más muertes en ellas, de acuerdo con información de la Secretaría de Salud de la Ciudad de México. VGB

author: MENAFN
title: Zelensky Thanks France For Supporting Ukraine | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - UkrinForm) Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky thanked France and President Emmanuel Macron for supporting Ukraine.
Zelensky said this in a post on Facebook , Ukrinform reports.
"Recently, we have signed a security agreement with France on long-term support to ensure greater security and joint strength. Cooperation in security, financial and defense areas, joint political steps. Very specific things that are helping Ukraine defend its independence," Zelensky said.
Read also: France to join Czechia's initiative to purchase ammunition for Ukraine He thanked France and President Macron personally for helping Ukraine.
"I am grateful to our teams for preparing the agreement and for setting out exactly what we need," Zelensky said.
